note.p: Education: Apprenticed to Solomon Richards, surgeon York Street (1791); College of Surgeons, Ireland (1798); Meath Hospital; MD (1800, Glasgow)

Career: In the Army Medical Department; surgeon to the Meath Hospital (1798-1858); taught anatomy; member of the Court of Assistants (1801); surgeon to the Westmoreland Lock Hospital for Venereal Diseases (1806); Surgeon General to the Forces in Ireland (1813); Surgeon in Ordinary to the Queen; involved in the foundation of the Royal Zoological Society of Ireland, became President; discovered Musculus cramtonius - a tiny muscle in the eyes of birds which facilitates fine adjustments of avian vision
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Irish Inventors
